item.title: Barenaked Ladies - God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of Dm.
As performed by The Barenaked Ladies (Featuring Sarah McLachlan)
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Barenaked Ladies - I Have A Little Dreidel
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of G (Original Key)
As performed by the Barenaked Ladies. I do have another version of this song in C...but this version is fun...and short!
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
The colored font matches Aquila KIDS ukulele strings.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd

item.title: Barenaked Ladies - If I Had $1,000,000
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of G.
Chords Used: G, D, C, Em
As performed by the Barenaked Ladies.
Video created on iMovie.
There is a master list of all similar play along videos at my blog: ukestuff.info. Access to the blog, and all materials on the blog is free.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel!
